meanings.definition: To cause someone to believe firmly in the truth of something.
meanings.sent1: She convinced her friend that unicorns are real.
meanings.sent2: I am convinced that the sun rises in the east.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog convinced the cat to join a band.
meanings.sent4: His smile convinced me that happiness is contagious.
meanings.sent5: The evidence presented in court convinced the jury of his innocence.

meanings.definition: To firmly believe in the truth of something.
meanings.sent1: He is convinced that eating vegetables is good for health.
meanings.sent2: After seeing the results, she was convinced of the experiment's success.
meanings.sent3: The cat convinced himself that he could fly if he believed hard enough.
meanings.sent4: Her determination convinced me that anything is possible with hard work.
meanings.sent5: The old wise owl convinced the young birds to listen to his advice.

meanings.definition: To persuade someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: She convinced her brother to share his toys with her.
meanings.sent2: I convinced my friend to try bungee jumping with me.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox convinced the rabbit to play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm convinced me to join the volunteer group.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies convinced him to come into the kitchen.
